chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 22-year-old male with drug-induced liver injury (DILI) due to piperacillin-tazobactam. Peak lab values are provided in Table 3 and text: AST 151 U/L, ALT 170 U/L, ALP 217 U/L, direct bilirubin 0.7 mg/dL, indirect bilirubin 2.0 mg/dL, total bilirubin 2.0 mg/dL. INR and Albumin are not mentioned. The clinical outcome is improved/discharged as the patient recovered and was discharged with complete resolution of symptoms.

lab_results.Bilirubin: Total bilirubin 2.0 mg/dL, Direct bilirubin 0.7 mg/dL, Indirect bilirubin 2.0 mg/dL
